page.title: 05Employment: Wray
page.content: In Wray, there is a coal merchant, a postman who with his wife runs the Post Office and village store; a policeman, a vicar, a plumber, joiner and builders, a newsagent, and a hairdresser who visits people's houses. There is a curio shop and two Public Houses. The percentage of people commuting to Lancaster and Morecambe, or other towns or villages, is rising. Among these are teachers, engineers and solicitors, office, shop and hotel workers. There is little unemployment in Wray. Most of the people in the fell areas live and work there. The local farms provide a livelihood for a majority of the inhabitants. The farmworkers are mainly relatives who live close by.
